document.discussion_title: Tamir Rice's family to be paid $6 Million
document.topic_text: Tamir Rice's family to be paid $6 Million On Monday the city of Cleveland settled a federal lawsuit brought by the family of Tamir Rice for $6 million. In the order issued Monday, Judge Solomon Oliver broke the settlement down: The City of Cleveland will pay $3 million in 2016 and $3 million in 2017. Comment SJ News Online - St. John, KS By Inform Posted Apr. 25, 2016 at 11:15 AM By Inform Posted Apr. 25, 2016 at 11:15 AM On Monday the city of Cleveland settled a federal lawsuit brought by the family of Tamir Rice for $6 million. A 12 year old boy, Rice was shot dead by police officer Timothy Loehmann in 2014 while he was playing with a pellet gun in a park. In the order issued Monday, Judge Solomon Oliver broke the settlement down: The City of Cleveland will pay $3 million in 2016 and $3 million in 2017. The Cuyahoga County Sheriff's Department conducted a criminal investigation against the two officers. A grand jury, however, ultimately declined to charge them. Cuyahoga County prosecutor Timothy McGinty called Rice's killing the "perfect storm of human error." McGinty also said that the 12-year-old boy looked "older" than he was. By Inform SJ News Online - St. John, KS By Inform
